context_of_use: This use case is applicable in the context of managing customer orders within the system.
scope: The scope includes the process of reviewing and approving customer orders by the manager.
description: Allow managers to review and approve orders to progress business workflows.
triggering_event: A customer places an order that requires managerial approval.
preconditions: The manager is logged into the system.
There are pending orders that require approval.
postconditions: The order is approved and processed.
The customer is notified of the order status.
assumptions: The manager has the necessary permissions to approve orders.
The system is operational and accessible.
requirements_met: The manager can view pending orders.
The manager can approve or reject orders.
main_flow: 1. Manager logs into the system → System displays the dashboard with pending orders.
2. Manager selects an order to review → System displays order details.
3. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status and notifies the customer.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 2): Manager rejects the order → System updates the order status and notifies the customer.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): Manager fails to log in → System displays an error message.
information_for_steps: 2. Order details including items, customer information, and payment status.
3. Confirmation of order approval or rejection.
